article.headline: Coach parent Tapestry names Joanne Crevoiserat interim CEO as Jide Zeitlin resigns
article.body: Tapestry Inc. TPR, +0.80%, parent of the Coach, Stuart Weitzman and Kate Spade brands, said Chief Executive Jide Zeitlin is resigning from his role and from the board for personal reasons. The company named Chief Financial Officer Joanne Crevoiserat as interim CEO, and said it would launch a search for a permanent CEO including external candidates. Andrea Shaw Resnick, currently head of investor relations and corporate communications, has been named interim CFO. The company's lead independent director Susan Kropf has been named chair of the board. The company is expecting to report fiscal fourth-quarter earnings on Aug. 13. "These results, though pressured by the Covid-19 pandemic, exceeded internal expectations from a top and bottom-line perspective," the company said in a statement. "Importantly, gross margin expanded on a year-over-year basis, reflecting lower promotional activity, while inventory declined from prior year." The company ended the year with a cash balance of $1.4 billion. Shares rose 2.6% premarket, but have fallen 51% in the year to date, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has gained 0.7%.
